intro: Cheiranthus longipetalus, commonly known as the long-petaled wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its elongated, showy petals that are typically bright yellow or orange in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cheiranthus longipetalus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found growing on rocky or sandy ground.
